H0.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. The Origin of Life

H1.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. Natural Selection

H2.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. The Species Book

H3.text: what was the title of the book charles darwin wrote. On evolution

A4.text: Darwin published his theory of evolution with compelling evidence in On the Origin of Species (1859)

A5.text: Darwin first used the word evolution in The Descent of Man in 1871, before adding it in 1872 to the 6th edition of The Origin of Species

A6.text: On the Origin of Species (or, more completely, On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection, or the Preservation of Favoured Races in the Struggle for Life) is a work of scientific literature by Charles Darwin that is considered to be the foundation of evolutionary biology.
